definition: to disprove/to confirm (sth) to be false
certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]

sentences.english: Popper put forward the principle of falsifications.
sentences.chinese: 代表人物波普尔提出了证伪主义原则。

sentences.english: Of course, the falsificationism methodology of Popper has rationality and progressive meaning.
sentences.chinese: 波普尔证伪主义方法论具有合理性和进步意义。

sentences.english: At the same time, scientific theory should be falsifiability and formal beauty.
sentences.chinese: 同时科学理论应当是可证伪的和形式美的。

sentences.english: Free will hasn’t been disproved scientifically or philosophically.
sentences.chinese: 自由意志在科学和哲学上都未被证伪。

sentences.english: You can't prove it or disprove it, and you can't test it.
sentences.chinese: 你不能证明它也不能证伪它，而且无从检验。

sentences.english: Focusing on the lack of logical sufficiency of verification, Falsificationism provides a new answer.
sentences.chinese: 针对证实的逻辑缺陷，证伪主义提出新的答案。

sentences.english: Falsificationism thought is an important constitute part of Popper's thought in the field of scientific philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 证伪主义思想是波普尔科学哲学的重要组成部分。

sentences.english: If they couldn't be proven wrong, they're not interesting enough to be science.
sentences.chinese: 如果理论不能够被证伪，那它们就算不上科学。

sentences.english: The most savage controversies are those about matters as to which there is no good evidence either way.
sentences.chinese: 最野蛮的争议是关于那些不能证实或者证伪的事物的。

sentences.english: The truth perjured is the key political toy in the social games.
sentences.chinese: 被证伪的真理是社会游戏当中主要的政治玩具。

sentences.english: Well, we'll talk about that, but the point here is they can be false.
sentences.chinese: 我们以后会慢慢讨论，但关键在于它们是可以证伪的。

sentences.english: This essay is a criticism on the logical basics of verification and falsification.
sentences.chinese: 本文对证实和证伪的逻辑基础进行了梳理和反省。

sentences.english: Will Buddhists allow neuroscience to render their idea of reincarnation obsolete?
sentences.chinese: 佛教徒会允许神经科学证伪他们关于转世的想法吗？

sentences.english: Notice that there is no way of disproving this statement.
sentences.chinese: 这儿的陈述是无法证伪的。

definition: circular argument/logical error consisting of begging the question/Latin: petitio principii
agnosticism, the philosophical doctrine that some questions about the universe are in principle unanswerable
to prove a point/to expound on/to demonstrate or prove (through argument)/proof
conclusion/verdict/CL:個|个[ge4]/to conclude/to reach a verdict
